text: In terms of the number of individuals, which of the following taxa is most inclusive?
explanation:
Organisms are grouped together into taxa (singular: taxon) and given a taxonomic rank; groups of a given rank can be aggregated to form a super group of higher rank and thus create a taxonomic hierarchy. A class will be most inclusive.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A characteristic that can possibly be shared by both living and non living organisms is
explanation:
Both living and non-living things can increase in size. Both living and non-living organisms can increase in size, non-living can increase in size due to external force, for example when an iron rod is heated it increases in size, biomass is organic and is produced by living things like plants and animals
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The cell of an onion bulb can be differentiated from a cheek cell by the presence of
explanation:
A cell wall will be present in the onion bulb and absent in the cheek cell.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In plants, the structure that performs a similar function with the testis in mammals is the
explanation:
Anther is the part of the stamen where pollen is produced.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The bacteria type that are arranged in chains are the
explanation:
Most bacteria come in one of three basic shapes: coccus, rod or bacillus, and spiral. The cocci are spherical or oval bacteria having one of several distinct arrangements based on their planes of division.Division in one plane produces either a diplococcus or streptococcus arrangement.Based on planes of division, the coccus shape can appear in several distinct arrangements: diplococcus, streptococcus, tetrad, sarcina, and staphylococcus. The streptococcu arrangement gives an arrangement in chains
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The most abundant group of organisms in the animal kingdom is
explanation:
Insects are the most abundant group of living creatures on earth with up to 30 million estimated species of insect found worldwide.Insects can be found in all ranges of environments even (but limited) in the oceans and rivers. Insects feed on other, smaller insects and decaying leaf and plant matter.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Radial symmetry is a feature common to
explanation:
Radial Symmetry is a basic body plan in which the organism can be divided into similar halves by passing a plane at any angle along a central axis. This is exhibited by coelenterates
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is used mainly for balancing in fish?
explanation:
Dorsalfinshelp fish balance. The main purpose of the dorsal fin is to stabilize the animal against rolling and to assist in sudden turns.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The beak of a duck is structurally adapted for
explanation:
click here
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The most important characteristic that makes reptiles to conquer terrestrial habitats is the possession of
explanation:
It is the amniotic egg. This kind of egg is unique to the amniotes, a group that includes turtles, lizards, birds, dinosaurs, and mammals. The structure of the amniote egg is such that inside the egg are a series of fluid-filled membranes which permit the embryo to survive: the amnion, allantois, yolk sac, and chorion. Surrounding and protecting the embryo is the amnion, filled with amniotic fluid, and providing the embryo with a stable fluid environment.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a dicotyledonous stem, the zone between the epidermis and the pericycle is the
explanation:
It is the cortex
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The order of passage of food in the digestive system is?
explanation:
The correct order is ileum → caecum → large intestine → rectum.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: insectivorous plants traps and kill their prey to derive
explanation:
These plants obtain some nutrients by trapping and digesting various invertebrates, and occasionally even small frogs and mammals. Because insects are one of the most common prey items for most carnivorous plants, they are sometimes called insectivorous plants. Most plants absorb nitrogen from the soil through their roots. But carnivorous plants absorb nitrogen from their animal prey through their leaves specially modified as traps.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the alimentary system of a bird, the function of teeth is carried out by the
explanation:
Birds do not have teeth, so they swallow their food whole and their gizzard( a muscular part of their stomach) grinds up the food so they can digest it. therefore, in the alimentary canal of a bird, the gizzard carries out the teeth' function.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: What will happen when two equal-sized pieces of unripe pawpaw labeled X and Y are dropped into equal volumes of concentrated salt solution and distilled water respectively?
explanation:
PawpawYwill become turgid. pawpaw Y will absorb water and become turgid because it is in a hypotonic solution
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Exhaled air differs from inhaled air in that it
explanation:
It usually has more water vapour.\(C_6H_{12}O_6 + O_2 → 6CO_2 + 6H_2O\) + Energy.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the mammalian kidney, the Bowman''s capsules is located in the
explanation:
Bowman's capsule (or the Bowman capsule, capsula glomeruli, or glomerular capsule) is a cup-like sac at the beginning of the tubular component of a nephron in the mammalian kidney that performs the first step in the filtration of blood to form urine. It is located in the cortex.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A plant parenchyma cell also acts as a supporting tissue when it
explanation:
The parenchyma cells can function as a storage site for starch, proteins, oils, and so on but they contribute support to plants if they are turgid.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: During ovulation, an egg is released from the
explanation:
During Ovulation, a mature follicle called the Graafian follicle contains a secondary oocyte. this follicle causes a bulge on the surface of the ovary. it finally splits the ovarian lining and releases the ovum into the abdominal cavity.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The transmission of impulses along a nerve fibre is characterized by
explanation:
Neurons send messages electrochemically; this means that chemicals (ions) cause an electrical impulse. Neurons and muscle cells are electrically excitable cells, which means that they can transmit electrical nerve impulses. These impulses are due to events in the cell membrane.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The major consequences of bush burning in an ecosystem is
explanation:
Bush burning will lead to the loss of biological diversity
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following associations is an example of mutualism
explanation:
Mutualism describes a type of mutually beneficial relationship between organisms of different species. It is a symbiotic relationship in which two different species interact with and in some cases, totally rely on one another for survival. Zoochlorellae often colour their hosts green while the feeding of the hydra aids in the growth of the algae.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a typical freshwater habitat, the edge of the stream or pond constitutes the
explanation:
It is the littoral zone. It is the shallow part of the freshwater habitat that is close to the shore. this zone is also known to have the highest level of primary production because sunlight can easily penetrate this zone. hence photosynthetic activities are common.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The main ecological problem facing intertidal organisms is
explanation:
Desiccation refers to the drying out of a living organism, such as when aquatic animals are taken out of water. The intertidal zones lay exposed twice daily due to tidal movements.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Stomata of some plants are sunken and protected by hairs. These are features of
explanation:
A xerophyte is a species of plant that has adapted to survive in an environment with little liquid water, such as a desert or an ice- or snow-covered region in the Alps or the Arctic.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An ecological factor that will have the most limiting effects on the abundance of phytoplankton in a turbid pond is
explanation:
Light is needed by photoplanktons for photosynthesis
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
In an experiment to determine the percentage of air in a soil sample, the following readings were recorded:

volume of water in measuring cylinder = 500 cm3

volume of soil added to water = 350 cm3

volume of water and soil after stirring = 800 cm3

the percentage of air in the soil sample is
explanation:
The total volume of soil = 350cm³\(\frac{50}{350} × 100\)
= 14.28%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A boy who is fond of swimming in a pond finds himself passing urine with traces of blood. He is likely to have contacted
explanation:
Schistosomiasis is also known as bilharzia, snail fever, and Katayama fever. It is a disease caused by parasitic worms of the Schistosoma type. It may infect the urinary tract or the intestines. Signs and symptoms may include abdominal pain, diarrhea, bloody stool, or blood in the urine. In those who have been infected for a long time, liver damage, kidney failure, infertility, or bladder cancer may occur.The disease is spread by contact with water contaminated with the parasites. These parasites have been released from their freshwater snail hosts.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The easiest way to establish the level of pollution in a local stream is to measure the level of
explanation:
It is to measure the level of oxygen.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The Rhesus factor of blood was first identified in a category of
explanation:
The Rh, or rhesus, factor was discovered in 1940 by K. Landsteiner and A. S. Wiener when they observed that an injection of blood from a rhesus monkey into rabbits caused an antigenic reaction in the serum component of rabbit blood
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Genetically modified food products have not become universally accepted because

options.A: they are not tasty as others produced by conventional means
options.B: they are usually costlier than others produced by conventional means
options.C: their effects on human consumers is not yet fully understood
options.D: the technology can be applied only in developed countries

explanation:
The effect of genetically modified food products on human consumers is not yet fully understood. They include many food products such as many breakfast cereals, infant formula, salad dressing, bread, cereal, hamburgers, mayonnaise, veggie burgers, meat substitutes, soy cheese, tomato sauce, crackers, cookies, chocolate, candy, fried food, protein powder, baking powder, alcohol, vanilla, powdered sugar, peanut butter, ice cream.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A major adaptive feature of endoparasites is the

options.A: loss of the organ of movement
options.C: loss of the central nervous system

explanation:
An endoparasite is a parasite like a tapeworm, that lives inside its host. Loss of the organ of movement is a major adaptive feature
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The ability of a chameleon to change its colour is an adaptive feature for
explanation:
It is a feature for defense.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is the most advanced evolutionary development in plants?
explanation:
The most evolutionary advanced plant is the angiosperm with the presence of flowers and the production of fruits to aid seed dispersal.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following is a major cause of variation among organisms?
explanation:
The major cause of the evolution of organisms is sexual reproduction; during sexual reproduction, meiosis produces gametes, and during meiosis reshuffling of gametes occurs and brings variations. these variations are passed from one parent to the offspring.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Use the diagram above to answer this question. Which of the organisms is characterised by the possession of a chitinous exoskeleton?
explanation:
The chitinous exoskeleton is a characteristic feature of the phylum Arthropoda, I in the diagram is an example of an organism characterized by possessing a chitinous exoskeleton.

text: Use the diagram above to answer this question.The type of reproduction illustrated in IV is
explanation:
The organism labelled IV is the Hydra, and hydra primarily reproduces asexually through budding, where a new individual develops as an outgrowth from the parent's body, and then detaches when mature.

explanation:
The pulmonary artery carries de-oxygenated blood to the lungs to get oxygenated.

an endotherm or a homoiotherm is an organism that can regulate its body temperature through metabolic activities.

text: The natural process that produces adaptive evolutionary changes is
explanation:
Natural selection: this suggests the survival of individuals whose adaptive variations are more suited to the environment and whose traits are transmitted to subsequent generations. Natural selection is the primary explanation for evolutionary change.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
